knimeNode.name: JSON Output
knimeNode.shortDescription: Reads the content of a JSON column and makes it available to an external caller.

fullDescription.intro: Reads the content of a JSON column and makes it available to an external caller. This node is used in KNIME server web services, where the result of the web service is represented by the input of this node. By default a JSON array is returned, where each row of the input table is an element in the array. Table with no or only one row result in an array with zero or one element. This behaviour can be changed in the dialog, see the settings below.
fullDescription.option: A name, which serves as key in the resulting JSON object. This is used to assert uniqueness in case multiple output results (nodes) are present in workflow.
The column containing the JSON result. All other columns are ignored.

For the special case that the input table contains one row with a non-missing JSON object ({...}) this object is taken as result. Otherwise the result is wrapped into a JSON array, which is wrapped into an object with key "array" containing the enumeration of all elements. This happens if the table has no rows or more than one, or in presence of missing values or other-typed JSON values such as arrays or primitives.

ports.inPort: A table containing a JSON column whose content is made available to the caller.

views.view: Shows the JSON structure as read from the input (possibly converted into JSON array)
